intro: Crassothonna agaatbergensis, commonly known as the Agaatberg pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Crassothonna agaatbergensis is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is often found in mountainous regions of the Western Cape.
